author: agemanning
content:
<@!340345049063882753> - I'm doing some discv5 testing and grabbed the first two teku mainnet bootnodes from here: https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-mainnet/blob/master/bootnodes.txt

The first one has some strange behaviour, in that the first few buckets (256-252) appear to be empty, but there are some nodes in the lower buckets. This might indicate some issue in the code. 
And the second bootnode I think is offline, just FYI

author: ajsutton
content: Thanks. Will look into this tomorrow.

author: ajsutton
content: Both bootnodes are running but we may have screwed up and changed the ip or something.

author: agemanning
content: Yeah cool. The first one I tried seems to be responding, but it only gave me peers on lower distances, which is really odd. Wonder if this happens with you also

author: ajsutton
content:
I don’t have my laptop with me to check. There’s been some changes to discv5 to support besu I think - I doubt they’d cause issues but does mean I’m not familiar with the latest changes there personally. 
Could have been going wrong for ages though - discovery can be very forgiving of odd behaviour and still find peers

author: agemanning
content: Yeah for sure. It would be hard to find if it has existed for a while

author: deme1744
content: fyi, I see the same behaviour when testing from the nimbus implementation.
